We are still reserving our remaining seat for applicants who are higher in our admissions priority order and may still engage with us in upcoming rounds. If our seat remains unfilled after those higher-priority possibilities are no longer available, we may be able to reconsider remaining candidates at that point.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions

[REJECT]
conversation.thought: Student_E is 4th on School_C’s true priority list (behind Student_B, Student_A, Student_D). School_C has quota 1 and is currently unmatched. Student_E has repeatedly applied and credibly commits to enroll immediately, but accepting now could forgo the chance to match with a higher-priority student if they later turn to School_C. From preferences: Student_B ranks School_C 2nd (after School_E), Student_C ranks School_C 2nd (but is last on our list), Student_A and Student_D rank School_C last. School_E likely attracts Student_B and Student_E; if Student_B fails to secure School_E, they may apply to School_C, which is our top choice. Given we are only at round 12/30 and the upside of waiting for Student_B (or Student_A) is significant, it is still rational to hold the seat. Therefore reject Student_E again while indicating we are still reserving for higher-priority applicants and suggesting they can continue to check back.

At this point in the process, we are prepared to finalize our remaining seat. We are pleased to offer you admission to School_C. Please confirm your acceptance so we can complete the match.

conversation.thought: School_C’s true priority is B > A > D > E > C, so Student_E is 4th. However, by round 13 no higher-priority student has approached School_C. From preferences: Student_B ranks School_C 2nd but likely applies to School_E first (where E prioritizes B highly) and could get matched there; Student_A ranks School_C last; Student_D ranks School_C last; Student_C ranks School_C 2nd but is lowest on our priority list. Given repeated holding has not attracted higher-priority applicants and the process is advancing, accepting Student_E now secures a filled seat with an eager, committed candidate rather than risking ending unmatched. Student_E is on our acceptable list, so accept.
